analysis: The documents all pertain to labor disputes that threaten to disrupt interstate commerce. They involve various industries, including railroads, airlines, meat-packing, and aircraft production. A common element is the creation of a board of inquiry or emergency board to investigate the disputes and report findings to the President. The goal is to prevent strikes or lockouts that would imperil the national health, safety, or essential transportation services.
title: Presidential Intervention in Labor Disputes
